abstracts.cdata!:
The Additional Financing to the Fourth
            Roads Rehabilitation and Maintenance Project for Nicaragua
            has as its development objectives: (a) to improve the
            recipient's transport infrastructure along selected
            main road corridors; (b) to improve access to productive
            zones and to rural communities; and (c) to ensure the
            sustainability of the road improvements carried out under
            the project. The project supports road improvements along
            existing road alignments and does not involve major earth
            works or any land acquisition. None of the road candidates
            involve crossing through protected areas or other
            environmentally sensitive zones. In accordance with the type
            of subprojects and the magnitude of the works, there was no
            expectation of significant negative environmental impacts
            that could put at risk the natural surrounding and/or social
            environment where the works were executed. To the contrary,
            the project was foreseen to have positive environmental and
            social impacts.
